info.title: Blackbaud Raisers Edge NXT Eve
info.description: Blackbaud Raiser's Edge NXT is a comprehensive cloud-based fundraising and donor management software solution built specifically for nonprofits and the entire social good community. Use the Events connector to manage events and participants.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view event categories.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Filter based on event category.

parameters.name: lookup_id
parameters.description: A filter for results that match the custom identifier for the event record.

parameters.name: start_date_from
parameters.description: Filter the results to events with start date on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18').

parameters.name: start_date_to
parameters.description: Filter the results to events with start date on or before the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18').

parameters.name: include_inactive
parameters.description: Include inactive events?

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 10000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: Filter the events that match the specified system record ID.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter for events that match the specified name.

parameters.name: date_added
parameters.description: Filter the results to events created on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

parameters.name: last_modified
parameters.description: Filter the results to events modified on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

200.description: Returned when the operation succeeds. The response body contains a collection and count of filtered events.

400.description: Returned when the specified request parameters are not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view the event records.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the event to create.

200.description: Returned when the operation succeeds. The response body contains the ID of the new event.

400.description: Returned when the specified request body is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to create the event.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the event to get.

400.description: Returned when the specified event ID in the request URL is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view the event record.

404.description: Returned when the specified event is not found.

patch.description: Updates the details about an event.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the event to update.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the properties of the event to update.

400.description: Returned when the specified request body is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to edit the event.

404.description: Returned when the specified event is not found.

get.description: Lists the attachments for an event.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the event.

400.description: Returned when the specified event ID in the request URL is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view the attachments.

404.description: Returned when the specified event is not found.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the event.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the attachment to create.

200.description: Returned when the operation successfully creates an attachment. The response body contains the ID of the new attachment.

400.description: Returned when the request body is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to create the attachment.

404.description: Returned when the specified event is not found.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the event.

parameters.name: attachment_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the attachment to update.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the properties of the attachment to update.

200.description: Returned when the operation successfully updates the attachment.

400.description: Returned when the specified attachment ID in the request URL or the specified request parameters are not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to update the attachment.

404.description: Returned when the specified attachment is not found.

get.description: Lists the fees for an event.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the event.

400.description: Returned when the specified request parameters are not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view the event fees.

404.description: Returned when the specified event is not found.

post.description: Creates a new fee for an event.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the event.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the event fee to create.

200.description: Returned when the operation succeeds. The response body contains the ID of the new event fee.

400.description: Returned when the specified request parameters are not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to create the fee.

404.description: Returned when the specified event is not found.

get.description: Lists the participant options for an event.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the event.

400.description: Returned when the specified request does not contain a valid ID.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view the event record.

404.description: Returned when the specified event is not found.

post.description: Creates a new participant option for an event.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The ID of the event.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the event participant option to create.

200.description: Returned when the operation succeeds. The response body contains the ID of the new event participant option.

400.description: Returned when the route does not contain a valid ID or the specified request body is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to modify the event record.

404.description: Returned when the specified event is not found.

get.description: Lists the participants for an event.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the event.

parameters.name: rsvp_status
parameters.description: Filter participants based on RSVP status.

parameters.name: invitation_status
parameters.description: Filter participants based on invitation status.

parameters.name: participation_level
parameters.description: Filter participants based on level of involvement.

parameters.name: attended_filter
parameters.description: Filter for including or excluding participants marked as attended.

parameters.name: fees_paid_filter
parameters.description: Filter for including or excluding participants that have paid their fees.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 10000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination.

parameters.name: is_constituent_filter
parameters.description: Filter for including or excluding participants who are constituents.

parameters.name: email_eligible_filter
parameters.description: Filter for including or excluding participants based on whether they have a primary email address that's not marked Do not email?

parameters.name: phone_call_eligible_filter
parameters.description: Filter for including or excluding participants based on whether they have a primary phone number that's not marked Do not call.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter for participants that match the specified name.

parameters.name: date_added
parameters.description: Filter the results to participants created on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

parameters.name: last_modified
parameters.description: Filter the results to participants modified on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

EventApi.AdministrativeArea.description: Defines the data model used for an address' administrative area (ex: state in the US).

id.description: The record ID of the administrative area.

name.description: The name of the administrative area.

short_description.description: The short description of the administrative area.

EventApi.Country.description: Defines the data model used for an address' country.

id.description: The ID of the country record.

display_name.description: The display name of the country.

iso_alpha2_code.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code for the country.

id.description: The ID of the newly created event.
The ID of the newly created event attachment.
The ID of the newly created event fee.
The ID of the newly created event participant option.
The ID of the newly created participant.
The ID of the newly created participant donation.
The ID of the newly created participant fee.

EventApi.CreateEvent.description: Events are planned occasions that help organizations raise awareness for their missions, engage constituents, and encourage donations.

name.description: The name of the event.
The category name.

start_date.description: The start date of the event (ex: '2020-09-18').

start_time.description: The start time of the event (ex: '07:30').

end_date.description: The end date of the event (ex: '2020-09-18').

end_time.description: The end time of the event (ex: '07:30)'.

lookup_id.description: The lookup ID of the event.

capacity.description: The number of people that can attend the event.

goal.description: The monetary goal of the event.

campaign_id.description: The system record ID of the campaign associated with the event.

fund_id.description: The system record ID of the fund associated with the event.

EventApi.CreateEventFee.description: Event fees are how much an organization charges for individuals or organizations to participate in or attend the event.

name.description: The name of the fee.

cost.description: The amount of money associated with the fee.

contribution_amount.description: The amount of the fee that's a donation above the costs of the event.

EventApi.CreateEventParticipantOption.description: Event participant options are fields that collect details about participants, such as t-shirt sizes, meal preferences, or seating requests. Set options and their values for an event and then add responses for each participant.

name.description: The name of the event participant option.

input_type.description: The types of values participants can use to provide responses.

multi_select.description: Allow more than one value for lists?

list_options.description: The available options for the list.

EventApi.CreateParticipant.description:
Participants are individuals or organizations who engage with the organization through an event. 
They can include constituents who receive invitations or register for the event.

constituent_id.description: The constituent ID of the participant.

host_id.description: The ID of the host's participant record.

rsvp_status.description: The status of the participant's engagement with the event.

attended.description: Did the participant attend the event?

invitation_status.description: The status of the invitation to the participant.

d.description: The day in the fuzzy date.

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

y.description: The year in the fuzzy date.

d.description: The day in the fuzzy date.

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

y.description: The year in the fuzzy date.

name.description: The name of the participation level.

summary_note.description: Quick reference information pinned to the participant's record.

EventApi.CreateParticipantDonation.description: Participant donations are donations made toward the event.

gift_id.description: The systetm record ID of the gift to which the participant donation is linked.

EventApi.CreateParticipantFee.description: Participant fees are how much an individual or organization pays to participate in or attend the event.

event_id.description: The system record ID of the event.

fee_amount.description: The amount of money associated with the fee.

contribution_amount.description: The amount of the fee that's a donation above the costs of the event. This is the amount that typically appears on receipts.

date.description: The date of the participant fee.

d.description: The day in the fuzzy date.

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

y.description: The year in the fuzzy date.

EventApi.CreateParticipantFeePayment.description: Participant fee payments are payments toward the participant's fees.

gift_id.description: The systetm record ID of the gift to which the participant fee is linked.

applied_amount.description: The amount of the payment that applies toward the participant fees.

EventApi.CreateParticipantOption.description: Participant options are the responses to an event participant option.

event_id.description: The system record ID of the event.

EventApi.CreateParticipantOptionListOpti.description: List options for event participant options are the values participants can select when they provide responses.

name.description: The name of the list option.

name.description: The name of the event.
The category name.

start_date.description: The start date of the event (ex: '2020-09-18').

start_time.description: The start time of the event (ex: '07:30').

end_date.description: The end date of the event (ex: '2020-09-18').

end_time.description: The end time of the event (ex: '07:30').

lookup_id.description: The lookup ID of the event.

capacity.description: The number of people that can attend the event.

goal.description: The monetary goal of the event.

campaign_id.description: The system record ID of the campaign associated with the event.

fund_id.description: The system record ID of the fund associated with the event.

Participants are individuals or organizations who engage with the organization through an event.

option_value.description: The participant's response to the option.

id.description: The system record ID of the event.  This is not the same as the user-definable event identifier, which is stored in the lookup_id.

name.description: The name of the event.

start_date.description: The start date of the event.

start_time.description: The start time of the event.

end_date.description: The end date of the event.

end_time.description: The end time of the event.

lookup_id.description: The lookup ID of the event.

capacity.description: The number of people that can attend the event.

goal.description: The monetary goal of the event.

campaign_id.description: The system record ID of the campaign associated with the event.

fund_id.description: The system record ID of the fund associated with the event.

date_added.description: The date when the event was created.

date_modified.description: The date when the event was last modified.

id.description: The system record ID of the attachment.

parent_id.description: The system record ID of the event associated with the attachment.

type.description: The attachment type. Physical attachments are uploaded files such as images, PDFs, or Word documents that are saved locally or on the network. They are stored and managed in the system. Link attachments are links to files such as images, blog posts, or YouTube videos that are online or in a cloud storage account. They are stored and managed externally.

name.description: The name of the attachment. Character limit: 150.

url.description: The URL for the attachment. This is required for link attachments and not applicable for physical attachments.

file_name.description: The name of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

file_id.description: The identifier of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

thumbnail_id.description: The identifier of the thumbnail. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

thumbnail_url.description: The URL for a thumbnail. For physical attachments that are images only. Contains a time-bound signature that limits access to 60 minutes.

content_type.description: The content type. For physical attachments only.

file_size.description: The file size in bytes. For physical attachments only.

tags.description: The tags associated with the attachment.

count.description: The number of items available for retrieval into the collection after applying any request parameters. The limit and offset parameters do not affect the count, but to facilitate paging, they may affect the number of items in the value result set.

value.description: The set of items included in the response. This may be a subset of the items in the collection.

EventApi.EventCategory.description: Event category is the custom categorization for the event.

id.description: The system record ID of the event category.

name.description: The name of the event category.

EventApi.EventFee.description: Event fees are how much an organization charges for individuals or organizations to participate in or attend the event.

id.description: The system record ID of the event fee.

name.description: The name of the event fee.

contribution_amount.description: The tax deductible amount for this fee.

id.description: The system record ID of the event.

name.description: The name of the event.

start_date.description: The start date of the event.

start_time.description: The start time of the event.

end_date.description: The end date of the event.

end_time.description: The end time of the event.

lookup_id.description: The lookup ID of the event.

capacity.description: The number of people that can attend the event.

attending_count.description: The number of event participants who plan to attend.

revenue.description: The realized revenue of the event.

goal.description: The monetary goal of the event.

percent_of_goal.description: The realized revenue as a percentage of the goal revenue.

date_added.description: The date when the event was created.

date_modified.description: The date when the event was last modified.

EventApi.EventParticipantOption.description:
Event participant options are fields that collects details about participants, such as t-shirt sizes, meal preferences, or seating requests. 
Set options and their values for an event and then add responses for each participant.

id.description: The system record ID of the event participant option.

name.description: The name of the event participant option.

input_type.description: The type of the event participant option.

multi_select.description: Allow more than one value for lists?

added_by_user.description: The ID of the user that added the option.

updated_by_user.description: The ID of the user who modified the option.

added_by_service.description: The name of the service that added this option.

updated_by_service.description: The name of the service that modified this option.

date_added.description: The date when the option was created.

date_updated.description: The date when the option was last modified.

version.description: The version number of the option.

EventApi.EventParticipantOptionListOptio.description: A event participant option list option

id.description: The ID of the list option

name.description: The name of the list option

sequence.description: The sequence used to order the list options

id.description: The record ID of the locality record.

name.description: The name of the locality.

EventApi.Location.description: Defines the data model used for a location.

name.description: The name of the location.

id.description: The system record ID of the membership category.

name.description: The name of the membership category.

EventApi.NewEventAttachment.description: Many cultivation activities collect related collateral, such as correspondence and prospect research. Attachments can save this data on the appropriate record to maintain a complete view of those activities.

type.description: The attachment type. Physical attachments are uploaded files such as images, PDFs, or Word documents that are saved locally or on the network. They are stored and managed in the system. Link attachments are links to files such as images, blog posts, or YouTube videos that are online or in a cloud storage account. They are stored and managed externally.

name.description: The name of the attachment. Character limit: 150.

date.description: The date of the attachment (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z'). This field defaults to the current date and time if not supplied.

url.description: The URL for the attachment. This is required for link attachments and not applicable for physical attachments.

file_name.description: The name of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

file_id.description: The identifier of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

thumbnail_id.description: The identifier of the thumbnail. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

tags.description: The tags associated with the attachment.

id.description: The system record ID of the participant.

constituent_id.description: The constituent ID of the participant.

event_id.description: The system record ID of the event being attended.

host_id.description: The ID of the host's participant record.

rsvp_status.description: The status of the participant's engagement with the event.

attended.description: Did the participant attend the event?

invitation_status.description: The status of the invitation to the participant.

d.description: The day in the fuzzy date.

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

y.description: The year in the fuzzy date.

EventApi.ParticipantDonation.description: Defines a data model for a participant donation

id.description: The system record ID of the participant donation.

gift_id.description: The system record ID of the gift to which the participant donation is linked.

EventApi.ParticipantFee.description: Defines a data model for a participant fee

id.description: The ID of the participant fee.

participant_id.description: The ID of the record that the participant fee is linked to.

fee_amount.description: The amount of the participant fee.

tax_receiptable_amount.description: The tax deductible amount for this fee.

date.description: The date of the participant fee.

d.description: The day in the fuzzy date.

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

y.description: The year in the fuzzy date.

EventApi.ParticipantFeePayment.description: Defines a data model for a participant fee payment

id.description: The system record ID of the participant fee payment.

participant_id.description: The system record ID of the participant to which the participant fee payment is linked.

gift_id.description: The system record ID of the gift to which the participant fee payment is linked.

applied_amount.description: The applied amount of the participant fee payment.

id.description: The system record ID of the participant.

contact_id.description: The ID of the contact attending the event.

rsvp_status.description: The status of the participant's engagement with the event.

attended.description: Did the participant attend the event?

invitation_status.description: The status of the invitation to the participant.

d.description: The day in the fuzzy date.

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

y.description: The year in the fuzzy date.

name.description: The participant's full name.

do_not_email.description: Can the participant be contacted at this email address?

do_not_call.description: Can the participant be contacted at this number?

total_registration_fees.description: The sum of the participant's fee amounts.

total_paid.description: The sum of the participant's paid gifts with a type of Registration Fees.

donations.description: The sum of the participant's paid gifts with a type of Donations.

revenue.description: The sum of the participant's paid gifts across all types.

seat.description: The seat assignment for the participant.

name_tag.description: The name tag for the participant

date_modified.description: The date when the participant was last modified.

name.description: The participant's full name.

memberships.description: The membership information for the participant.

EventApi.ParticipantOption.description: The participant option associated with a given participant

id.description: The system record ID of the participant option.

participant_id.description: The system record ID of the participant.

event_id.description: The system record ID of the event.

event_participant_option_id.description: The system record ID of the event participant option.

option_value.description: The participant's response to the option.

added_by_user.description: The ID of the user that added the participant option.

updated_by_user.description: The ID of the user who modified the participant option.

added_by_service.description: The name of the service that added this participant option.

updated_by_service.description: The name of the service that modified this participant option.

date_added.description: The date when the participant option was created.

date_updated.description: The date when the participant option was last modified.

EventApi.ParticipationLevel.description: Participation levels are the level of involvement participants have in an event.

id.description: The system record ID of the participation level.

name.description: The name of the participation level.

EventApi.SubAdministrativeArea.description: Defines the data model used for an address' sub-administrative area (ex: city in the US).

id.description: The ID of the sub-administrative area.

name.description: The name of the sub-administrative area.

EventApi.UpdateEventAttachment.description: Many cultivation activities collect related collateral, such as correspondence and prospect research. Attachments can save this data on the appropriate record to maintain a complete view of those activities.

name.description: The name of the attachment. Character limit: 150.

url.description: The URL for the attachment. This is required for link attachments and not applicable for physical attachments.

tags.description: The tags associated with the attachment.

id.description: The dynamic value item identifier.

PowerAutomateUIApi.DynamicValuesCollecti.description: A collection of objects for use with dynamic values.

count.description: The number of items in the list.

value.description: The set of objects for use with dynamic values.

PowerAutomateUIApi.DynamicProperties.description: Defines some (but potentially not all) dynamic OpenApi metadata properties needed for a custom field.

items.description: The OpenApi properties for the custom field value.
